more fixes for CircleCI API publish config

Signed-off-by: Ben Burns <803016+benjamincburns@users.noreply.github.com>

timeline.bodyText: Isn't there a race condition here? We'd need to wait until the rest api service has actually started listening.
timeline.author: ajsutton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -266,57 +268,101 @@ jobs:
             docker login --username "${DOCKER_USER}" --password "${DOCKER_PASSWORD}"
             ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel "-Pbranch=${CIRCLE_BRANCH}" dockerUpload
 
+  publishAPIDoc:
+    executor: medium_executor
+    steps:
+      - prepare
+      - add_ssh_keys:
+          fingerprints:
+            - '45:36:58:67:43:15:c6:5f:2c:58:ec:7f:71:e2:e6:ef'
+      - run:
+          name: Build runnable Teku binaries
+          command: |
+            ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel installDist
+      - run:
+          name: Extract OpenAPI JSON
+          command: |
+            build/install/teku/bin/teku --rest-api-docs-enabled=true &
+            TEKU_PID=$!
+            wget -O api.json http://localhost:5051/swagger-docs

timeline.message:
update from master

and add TODO to change before merge

use a testnet to be able to start Teku

bypass #1720
update commit message to show it's from CI
Update commit message to include CI infos

make sure doc is updated only if everything works

extract and publish API doc only if all tests and publishing worked
otherwise it could be updated even if some tests fails and teku is
not published

make changes ready to merge on master

[skip ci] as we don't want the branch push to update the real doc
the update will be triggered when merged on master.
The tag part (creating a version when a tag is created) is not yet
available. Only the latest will be built automatically for the
moment until this tag CI part is solved. Until then at least we will
have the master updating the latest doc version. If needed a named
version can be generated manually until we figure this out.

small change to update CI

I tried not to fire ci in the previous commit but CI status is needed
It will update the doc but as this branch is up to date with master
it's ok and even a good live test.
Doc rollback is easy in case of issue.

fix typo

badly typed save shortcut ctrl+s added an "s"

timeline.bodyText: This has a race condition because Teku won't be listening the instant it's started.  We need something to retry for a period until the API is actually listening.  I would suggest splitting the script to do that into it's own file so that the circleci config stays as focussed on circleci specific stuff as possible.
timeline.author: ajsutton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -266,6 +272,76 @@ jobs:
             docker login --username "${DOCKER_USER}" --password "${DOCKER_PASSWORD}"
             ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel "-Pbranch=${CIRCLE_BRANCH}" dockerUpload
 
+  extractAPISpec:
+    executor: medium_executor
+    steps:
+      - prepare
+      - attach_workspace:
+          at: ~/project
+      - run:
+          name: Build runnable Teku binaries
+          command: |
+            ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel installDist
+      - run:
+          name: Extract OpenAPI JSON
+          command: |
+            build/install/teku/bin/teku --network=schlesi --rest-api-docs-enabled=true &
+            TEKU_PID=$!
+            wget -O openapi.json http://localhost:5051/swagger-docs
+            kill $TEKU_PID

replies.bodyText: As I already explained in a previous comment, there's no race condition here. Wget is retrying 20 times until it has a 200 code.
replies.author: NicolasMassart

replies.bodyText: Ah right, I didn't see that response because it got resolved before I had a chance to see it.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText:
Would this be:
git checkout "$BRANCH" && git pull || git checkout -b "$BRANCH"
ie only pull the branch if it already existed.
timeline.author: ajsutton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -266,6 +272,76 @@ jobs:
             docker login --username "${DOCKER_USER}" --password "${DOCKER_PASSWORD}"
             ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel "-Pbranch=${CIRCLE_BRANCH}" dockerUpload
 
+  extractAPISpec:
+    executor: medium_executor
+    steps:
+      - prepare
+      - attach_workspace:
+          at: ~/project
+      - run:
+          name: Build runnable Teku binaries
+          command: |
+            ./gradlew --no-daemon --parallel installDist
+      - run:
+          name: Extract OpenAPI JSON
+          command: |
+            build/install/teku/bin/teku --network=schlesi --rest-api-docs-enabled=true &
+            TEKU_PID=$!
+            wget -O openapi.json http://localhost:5051/swagger-docs
+            kill $TEKU_PID
+      - persist_to_workspace:
+          root: ~/project
+          paths:
+            - ./
+
+  publishAPIDoc:
+    executor: node_executor
+    steps:
+      - checkout
+      - attach_workspace:
+          at: /tmp/project
+      - add_ssh_keys:
+          fingerprints:
+            - '45:36:58:67:43:15:c6:5f:2c:58:ec:7f:71:e2:e6:ef'
+      - run:
+          name: Set Git user params
+          command: |
+            git config --global user.name $CIRCLE_USERNAME
+            git config --global user.email "${CIRCLE_USERNAME}@users.noreply.github.com"
+      - run:
+          name: Chechout GitHub Pages branch
+          command: |
+            readonly BRANCH='gh-pages'
+            git checkout "$BRANCH" || git checkout -b "$BRANCH"
+            # pull might fail if the branch was just created
+            git pull || true

replies.bodyText: @benjamincburns you wrote these lines, do you have any comments on this please?
replies.author: NicolasMassart

replies.bodyText:
Ignore my last (deleted) comment - I had my wires crossed.
I think @ajsutton's suggestion is functionally equivalent to the code that we already have, but it'll save some noise in the build log if you change line 315 to what he has, and delete lines 316 and 317.
Also if the git pull fails in the one-liner that he suggested, it'll cause the git checkout -b "$BRANCH" statement to execute, which will also fail, causing the entire build to fail, however the build log might make the reason for the failure a little obscure. A better approach overall would be replace lines 315:317 with something like
if [ git branch | grep -q "$BRANCH" ]; then
  git checkout "$BRANCH"
  git pull
else
  git checkout -b "$BRANCH"
fi
But this is likely overkill and I think any of the suggestions will work fine.
replies.author: benjamincburns
